name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $url
desc: Returns: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this code system is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the code system is stored on different servers. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an aut

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $addidentifier
desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $::version
desc: Returns: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).version.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For exampl

name: $::name
desc: Returns: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

name: $title
desc: Returns: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The date (and optionally time) when the code system resource was created or revised.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date (and optionally time) when the code system resource was created or revised.

name: $experimental
desc: Returns: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

name: $date
desc: Returns: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes

name: $publisher
desc: Returns: The name of the organization or individual that published the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the organization or individual that published the code system.

name: $contact
desc: Returns: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $addcontact
desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $description
desc: Returns: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

name: $useContext
desc: Returns: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

name: $adduseContext
desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist w

name: $jurisdiction
desc: Returns: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

name: $addjurisdiction
desc: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

name: $purpose
desc: Returns: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

name: $copyright
desc: Returns: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

name: $caseSensitive
desc: Returns: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

name: $valueSet
desc: Returns: Canonical reference to the value set that contains the entire code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Canonical reference to the value set that contains the entire code system.

name: $hierarchyMeaning
desc: Returns: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.

name: $compositional
desc: Returns: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.

name: $versionNeeded
desc: Returns: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

name: $content
desc: Returns: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

name: $supplements
desc: Returns: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.

name: $count
desc: Returns: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.

name: $filter
desc: Returns: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

name: $addfilter
desc: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

name: $property
desc: Returns: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

name: $addproperty
desc: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

name: $concept
desc: Returns: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.

name: $addconcept
desc: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.
